00024 class PIDController
00025 {
00026 private:
00027     float m_P;          // factor for "proportional" control
00028     float m_I;          // factor for "integral" control
00029     float m_D;          // factor for "derivative" control
00030     float m_maximumOutput;  // |maximum output|
00031     float m_minimumOutput;  // |minimum output|
00032     float m_maximumInput;       // maximum input - limit setpoint to this
00033     float m_minimumInput;       // minimum input - limit setpoint to this
00034     bool m_continuous;  // do the endpoints wrap around? eg. Absolute encoder
00035     bool m_enabled;             //is the pid controller enabled
00036     float m_prevError;  // the prior sensor input (used to compute velocity)
00037     double m_totalError; //the sum of the errors for use in the integral calc
00038     float m_tolerance;  //the percetage error that is considered on target
00039     float m_setpoint;
00040     float m_error;
00041     float m_result;
00042     float m_period;

00047     PIDOutput *m_pidOutput;
00048     Notifier *m_controlLoop;
00049

00051     void Calculate();
00052     DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(PIDController);
00053 public:
00054     PIDController(float p, float i, float d,
00055                     PIDSource *source, PIDOutput *output,
00056                     float period = 0.05);
00057     ~PIDController();
00058     float Get();

00060     void SetInputRange(float minimumInput, float maximumInput);
00061     void SetOutputRange(float mimimumOutput, float maximumOutput);
